title: OOP in an Hour
content: Alex [knows his stuff](http://mybizmo.blogspot.com/2006/01/more-on-iq.html)Learn OOP the Python way, from a master.  Sure, it's a home movie in some ways, but that's part of its charm.This takes us back a ways, to the dawn of Python 2.3 when the property descriptor was introduced.  [What's a descriptor](http://users.rcn.com/python/download/Descriptor.htm) again?  If you've heisted the __set__, __get__ and __delete__ rib cage, that makes you one.Note: every Python class comes with a "rib cage" of special names or [__ribs__](http://controlroom.blogspot.com/2007/01/python-for-math-teachers.html), for which you're free to define special behaviors.  Snakes have lots of ribs so this all makes some sense, no?
author: Kirby Urner
